title: Reinforcement Learning Simulation Design for Strengthening Cybersecurity in Microgrids

context.prior_knowledge: Power systems fundamentals, machine learning concepts, and Python programming proficiency
context.additional_context: Modular learning focused on simulations and practical exercises in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can design control strategies to respond to microgrid cyberattacks using a Federated Reinforcement Learning (Fed-RL) algorithm.
Learners can build a testbed for interconnecting three microgrids in a collaborative simulation environment based on GridLAB-D/HELICS.
Learners can apply a Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) verification methodology to minimize performance differences between simulation and real-world environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
